item.title: Moment.js | Docs
item.description: Moment.js has been successfully used in millions of projects, and we are happy to have contributed to making date and time better on the web. As of September 2020, Moment gets over 12 million downloads per week! However, Moment was built for the previous era of the JavaScript ecosystem. The modern web looks much different these days. Moment has evolved somewhat over the years, but it has essentially the same design as it did when it was created in 2011. Given how many projects depend on it, we choose to prioritize stability over new features.

item.title: Raspberry Pi as a local server for self hosting applications
item.description: Doing an experiment with my RPi 4, using it as a small but powerful local server My current PC is a 10 year old Macbook Pro 13&quot; 2010, which is sluggish sometimes So I want to offload some heavy tasks (ffmpeg time-lapse creation, long-running tasks and services) to the Raspberry Pi and connect to it either via LAN or Wi-Fi Below you can read my findings about performance, applications and general issues I encountered and tried to solve Table of Contents First steps Connection via LAN to PC Internet Sharing from PC to RPi Connection via Wi-Fi Benchmarking Transfer speeds via iperf Benchmark over LAN Benchmark over Wi-Fi Applications ffmpeg for time-lapse n8n for automation emby for media server hakatime Final words First steps I started by: Flashing a minimal RaspiOS Buster Lite image on a 32GB SD card (prob better for the future if I used a 128GB one) No setup of Wi-Fi connectivity through wpa_supplicant Creating an empty ssh file in the SD card to enable SSH access Powered up the Pi and I was able to connect via LAN
item.author: (Christian Fei)

item.title: Don't get burned by missing await Calls for Async Code in ASP.NET Core Middleware
item.description: I recently got burned in an upgraded ASP.NET Core server application where a missing `await` statement caused wildly inconsistent and puzzling output failures. While a simple thing to avoid, once introduced it's possible to live with this error for some time before it manifests. In this post I show a scenario where a missing `await` was causing infrequent HTTP response errors, even though the client apparently receives a valid response.
item.author: (https://facebook.com/rickstrahl)

item.title: Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore 5.0.0-rc.1.20451.13
item.description:
Entity Framework Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations. EF Core works with SQL Server, Azure SQL Database, SQLite, Azure Cosmos DB, MySQL, PostgreSQL, and other databases through a provider plugin API.
Commonly Used Types: Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbContext Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbSet

item.author: (dotnet)

item.title: Phosphine gas in the cloud decks of Venus
item.description: The detection of ~20 ppb of phosphine in Venus clouds by observations in the millimetre-wavelength range from JCMT and ALMA is puzzling, because according to our knowledge of Venus, no phosphine should be there. As the most plausible formation paths do not work, the source could be unknown chemical processes—maybe even life?
item.author: (Jim Hoge)

item.title: The Art of Turboing
item.description: I first learned the term “turboing” when I worked second-level telephone technical support at Xerox. It refers to the actions of a customer who goes around the normal technical support process by contacting a senior person in the chain of command.
item.author: (CompUSA: How not to handle a turboing customer)

item.title: The compositor is evil
item.description: First, I want to make it clear that I’m not accusing the compositor of true evil, which I define roughly as deliberately causing suffering. There’s unfortunately too much of that in the world. I mean it in the more metaphorical sense that it causes serious problems and forces other parts of the system to be more complex to work around its limitations.

item.title: UBM, and a lament for the software industry
item.description: I grew up in tech as a UBM fan. Ok, not really a fan, but a “there’s very few voices writing books about ‘how to write code well’, and this person seems to know what they’re doing, so I’m going to listen to him”. I read all his books; attended talks he gave at SCNA, and thought for a while that his way was the right way.

item.title: Never Invest in the Business Model
item.description: I am an angel investor. I have been investing personally in early-stage companies, Pre-Seed through Series B, since 2015. I do it not for money but for love of the game; the greatest pleasure to me is to learn from entrepreneurs smarter than me, and help them succeed.

item.title: GNSS Jamming and Spoofing, aka Galileo's Authentication Algorithm Part 3 - Articles
item.description: Welcome to part 3 of my series on OSNMA, the proposed Galileo Navigation Message Authentication protocol. This part can be read independently from part 1 and part 2, but it might be useful to read the introduction to part 1. This post attempts to explain GPS (GNSS) jamming and spoofing, so it might be a useful read even if you don’t care about Galileo or its authentication. As usual, I’ve been helped tremendously by Daniel Estévez & many other researchers and Galileo professionals, and again I am very greatful for all the links, corrections, suggestions and knowledge you provided.

item.title: Febraury 13, 2020 - Blazor TreeView GridLines and starting the FormView component
item.description:
Today Fritz finished the GridLine implementation for the TreeView Blazor component and built a sample to show how the FormView should behave.
Questions: 15:13 - Does a TreeView really need grid lines? 44:38 - Do the TreeNodes register with the parent in Onlnitalized? 45:46 - Can TreeNodes register with the parent TreeNode as they're drawn? 47:41 - This is as close to a "Pattern" with Blazor: Child Components register with their Parent component 51:14 - Should I create my 'Creative Coding' stream? What worked for you and why did you start? 1:39:15 - Am I the only one that gets an SSL error for docs.microsoft.com? 2:07:40 - With Git push, shouldn't it be pushing the current branch if you don't provide a branch name?
Source Code at https://github.com/FritzAndFriends/BlazorWebFormsComponents Watch live at https://www.twitch.tv/csharpfritz
item.author: (Jeffrey T. Fritz)

item.title: Minimum Viable Air Quality Monitoring

item.title: February 14, 2020 - Blazor Coding with Squirrel
item.description:
In a fun-filled episode that was just NUTS to make, Fritz dons a squirrel costume provided by viewers as he writes code. After about 30 minutes of shenanigans and more puns than you can shake a stick at, Fritz gets back into working on the BlazorWebFormsComponents.
He continues working on the FormView component for Blazor, adding support for FooterTemplates. He is challenged by the viewers to use the Peanut Font while coding (http://www.fontriver.com/font/peanut/) and spends 15 minutes in that configuration. He adds the Pager feature to the FormView along with appropriate integration tests to show it off.
1:22:11 - Would you recommend a novice developer learn command line Git? Or is a GUI acceptable in 2002?
Source Code at https://github.com/FritzAndFriends/BlazorWebFormsComponents Watch live at https://www.twitch.tv/csharpfritz
item.author: (Jeffrey T. Fritz)

item.title: ASP.NET Community Standup - Sept 8 2020 - New Identity experience with Microsoft.Identity.Web
item.description:
The ASP.NET Core project templates now integrate with Microsoft.Identity.Web to handle authentication with Azure Activity Directory (Azure AD). Chrisos and JP will show you how the Microsoft.Identity.Web package provides a better experience for authentication through Azure AD as well as an easier way to access Azure resources on behalf of your users, including Microsoft Graph.
Community Links: https://www.theurlist.com/aspnet-standup-2020-09-08
Featuring: Christos Matskas (@ChristosMatskas), John Patrick Dandison (@AzureAndChill)

item.title: ‘Like an Experimental Concentration Camp’: Whistleblower Complaint Alleges Mass Hysterectomies at ICE Detention Center
item.description: Several legal advocacy groups on Monday filed a whistleblower complaint on behalf of a nurse at an Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) detention center documenting "jarring medical neglect" within the facility, including a refusal to test detainees for the novel coronavirus and an exorbitant rate of hysterectomies being performed on immigrant women.

item.title: ASP.NET Core updates in .NET 5 Release Candidate 1 | ASP.NET Blog
item.description: .NET 5 Release Candidate 1 (RC1) is now available and is ready for evaluation. Here’s what’s new in this release: Blazor WebAssembly performance improvements Blazor component virtualization Blazor WebAssembly prerendering Browser compatibility analyzer for Blazor WebAssembly Blazor JavaScript isolation and object references Blazor file input support Custom validation class attributes in Blazor Blazor support for ontoggle event Model binding DateTime as UTC Control Startup class activation Open API Specification (Swagger) on-by-default in ASP.NET Core API projects Better F5 Experience for ASP.NET Core API Projects SignalR parallel hub invocations Added Messagepack support in SignalR Java client Kestrel endpoint-specific options via configuration See the .NET 5 release notes for additional details and known issues.
item.author: (Daniel Roth)

item.title: Running a .NET Core application in Kubernetes - high level walk-through
item.description:
As I've been messing around with Kubernetes lately, thought it would be interesting to do a high level walk-through of running a .NET Core application in it.
It's far from a tutorial, but more for the folks that keep hearing about Kubernetes but are still a bit confused about what it does and how it may impact their daily work.
GitHub repository: https://github.com/joaofbantunes/HangfireSample
Feel free to leave feedback here or hit me up on: - https://twitter.com/joaofbantunes - https://blog.codingmilitia.com - https://dev.to/joaofbantunes

item.title: What's up with error C4838: a WinRT type cannot be a member of a union, and how can I work around it? | The Old New Thing
item.description: If you try to put a Windows Runtime type inside a std::optional from C++/CX, you get this error: std::optional<::Windows::Foundation::Rect> optRect; error C2848: 'std::_Optional_destruct_base<_Ty,true>::Value': A WinRT type cannot be a member of a union Why can’t a WinRT type be a member of a union?
item.author: (Raymond Chen Follow)

item.title: What's so hard about PDF text extraction? ​
item.description: There is a common view that extracting text from a PDF document should not be too difficult. After all, the text is right there in front of our eyes and humans consume PDF content all the time with great success. Why would it be difficult to automatically extract the text data? Turn
